p: Randomized controlled trials were initiated and are being conducted for many antiviral agents. Lopinavir (LPV) was shown to inhibit the protease activity of coronavirus in vitro and in animal models and already used for SARS and MERS in combination with ritonavir, another antiviral drug [ 75, 76]. However, a recent trial showed lopinavir-ritonavir has no treatment benefit for severely infected patients by SARS-CoV-2 [ 77]. Ribavirin is a guanosine analogue, used to treat several viral infections including those caused by the hepatitis C and respiratory syncytial viruses by targetting the RdRp complex [ 78]. Messenger RNA (mRNA) vaccine technology is also under development (in phase 1 clinical trial by the US National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases) [ 79].
